member.name: Amy Zhang
member.bio: Amy X. Zhang is an assistant professor at University of Washington's Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering, where she directs the Social Futures Lab. Her research interests are in social computing and HCI.

member.name: Shagun Jhaver
member.bio: Shagun Jhaver is a postdoctoral researcher in the Social Futures Lab. His research focuses on online harassment and content moderation on social media websites like Facebook, Twitter and Reddit.

member.name: Quan Ze (Jim) Chen
member.bio: Quan Ze (Jim) is a current PhD student. He is interested in understading disagreement and ambiguity in human annotation and building  crowdsourcing and human-in-the loop workflows.

member.name: Ruotong Wang
member.bio: Ruotong Wang is a first year Ph.D. student at University of Washington's Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering. She is interested in understanding and developing sociotechnical systems that facilitate communication and collaboration among diverse community members.

member.name: Ge Zhang
member.bio: Ge Zhang is a senior undergraduate student at Peking University. Her research interests are in data mining and human-computer interaction, with a focus on scientific reproducibility and data science collaboration.

member.name: Wenjia Hu
member.bio: Wenjia just got her BA in Cognitive Science from Lawrence University. She is passionate about collective intelligence and tools for thoughts. Her research interest lies in the intersection of complexity science and HCI. She is also a UX researcher, and teaches kids design thinking on the side.

member.name: Emelia May Hughes
member.bio: Emelia Hughes is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Informatics and Drawing & Painting. Her research interests are in human-computer interaction, and she is currently focusing on the UX surrounding credibility.

member.name: Ricky Grannis-Vu
member.bio: Ricky Grannis-Vu is an undergraduate student at Stanford University. He studies the design and governance of online communities, with a focus on the PolicyKit project. He also works as an instructor, curriculum designer, and program manager at Inspirit AI.

member.name: Skyler Hallinan
member.bio: Skyler Hallinan is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying computer science. His research interests are in the intersection of NLP and HCI for social good.

member.name: Jenny Fan
member.bio: Jenny Fan is a designer and creative technologist interested in studying and reimagining digital civics in the online public sphere. She received her Masters in Design Engineering from Harvard University and B.S. Economics (with a focus on Information Systems) from the University of Pennsylvania, Wharton.

member.name: Renee Wang
member.bio: Renee Wang is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Computer Engineering. She is interested in researching misinformation and credibility.

member.name: Anson Huang
member.bio: Anson Huang is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying computer science and political science. His research interests are in the intersection of civics and tech.

member.name: Adithi Raghavan
member.bio: Adithi Raghavan is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Computer Science and Linguistics. Her research interests lie in human-computer interaction and misinformation.

member.name: Ryan Li
member.bio: Ryan Li is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Data Science. His research interests are in online misinformation and disinformation.
